turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: Well, if you gentlemen will excuse me, I have some pressing matters to attend to.

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: I'm not running a charity ward...

turns.speaker: HARDING
turns.text: Miss Ratched. Given all the conditions of that sublime relationship, coupled with the subsequent annihilation of all that I held to be sacred, mentally, physically and emotionally, the only thing that I can speculate on, at this late date, is how I will justify the very existence of my life, with or without my dear wife.

turns.speaker: SEFELT
turns.text: McMurphy killed two attendants and escaped...

turns.speaker: MARTINI
turns.text: Can you borrow me a dime?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Sorry, buddy, I'm clean outta change...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Big king... little deuce... another king... a lovely lady... big ten... and a trey... hey, hey, whadaya say? Ya hit or sit, Martini?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: That's twenty up, Martini.  Hey, Taber, who's pitching the opening game?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Wait a minute, Martini, I can't hear a thing.  What?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, an' I'm tellin' ya, she's just an icy-hearted over-the-hump gal who never got enough of the old wham-bam to straighten 'er out... Okay, who wants a card?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: You need four houses on every lot of the same color, Martini. Now let's go, for Christsakes.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Shhh. Wait a minute. You guys are gonna screw up my plans. So just gone on back to bed like nothin' happened.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Whadaya doin', there's no one there!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Okay, Martini. That's okay. Now you watch me.

turns.speaker: MARTINI
turns.text: I saw thum! I saw thum!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Man, there sure is an awful lot of poontang around here.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Why, I'll betcha there must be a million albacore and tuna running of the coast right this minute.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Oh, do you do much fishing?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yup! Worked right outta Depoe Bay for just about every season since I was able to haul my own weight.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: My, my... Ah, who are you?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Hell, Doc, I've been everything from a hoopla man with a two-bit carny show to a top mechanic and bull goose catskinner for every gypo loggin' operation in the Northwest till the Army taught me what my natural bent was.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, but you know how society persecutes a dedicated man.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: They say I'm a habitual hassler. Like I fight some. Sheeut. They didn't mind so much when I was a dumb logger and got into a hassle. That's a hardworkin' feller blowing off steam, they say. But if you're a gambler, all you have to do is spit slantwise and you're a goddamned criminal.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: To tell the truth, ever since I found my natural callin' I done time in so many small-time jails I could write a brochure...

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Yes... Ah, do you know why you're here?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Well, ya know, Doc...  Doesn't it say so there?

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Well, according to the Warden at Pendleton, you were a disturbing influence on others. 'It appears that there is a potential in him for instigating a revolt among the other inmates.'  What do you think of that report?

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Arrested on an assault charge five times...

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: The doctor at the prison states: 'Don't overlook the possibility that this man may be faking psychosis to escape the drudgery of the work farm...' What do you say to that?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Doc, what can I tell ya?

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Ah, it seems you have no other psychiatric history, Mister Murphy?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: No, this is my first trip, Doc.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Well, you're here for a ninety-day observation period, Mister McMurphy. I'd like you to understand you are here on a court order and we are responsible to the state. So, I'd like your cooperation!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Well, I was turnin' this dilemma over in my head, when I happened to hit on that old tub room out there, an' I said to myself, McMurphy, I said, that place would make a great second day room. A sort of game room for the young fellas. Whadaya think, Doc?

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: It is worth considering... Miss Ratched?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Just fine, Doc... In fact, I think I might've put on a couple of pounds since I got here.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Good, good, and how are you getting along on the ward?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Come on, Doc, you know as well as I do what's been comin' down in that loony bin.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Yes, well, Miss Ratched feels that you're a disturbing influence on the other patients.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Shoot, Doc, the only one I'm disturbing is that old nurse and her fixed ways. That's all.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: Yes, that may be so, but in making a careful study of your past record, along with your behavior since you arrived here, my feeling is that you are not mentally ill and it is going to be my recommendation that you be returned to Pendleton where they are better equipped to handle your case.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Come on, Doc, you must be kiddin'.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Jesus, that old nurse sure wants my ass in a sling, don't she!

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: No, Mister McMurphy, it's just that we cannot offer you the guidance and assistance that you would receive at Pendleton.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Guidance and assistance! That's insane! Doc, ya gotta help me.

turns.speaker: SPIVEY
turns.text: I'm sorry, but I can't keep you here.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Candy. Candy, over here.  Hey, Doc, time out.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Pardon me miss, but would you mind turning...

turns.speaker: NURSE PILBOW
turns.text: Stay back! Patients aren't allowed to enter the... Oh, stay back!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: What's the horse pill for, honey?

turns.speaker: NURSE PILBOW
turns.text: It's just medication, Mister McMurphy, good for you. Now down it goes...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Look, miss, I don't like swallowing something without knowing what it is!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: I'm not upset. All I wanna know, for the lovva Jesus...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Shhh. Hold it down! I'll take you guys down, but ya gotta come right back up! 'Kay?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Shhh... Remember this is a privilege, so I don't want none of you goons fuckin' up. Kay?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: 'Kay, let's see...  Cheswick first ... then Billy... Martini... Scanlon... Sefelt... Fredrickson... Taber an' the Chief... 'Kay

turns.speaker: TABER
turns.text: I want you to write me a letter to my brother for a hundred dollars to bury me.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: You look pretty healthy to me.

turns.speaker: TABER
turns.text: Yeah, you don't know how to get outta this place!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Put your money where your mouth is, Taber.

turns.speaker: TABER
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, you're a fucking phony, McMurphy!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: You want me to show ya! You want me to show ya how!

turns.speaker: TABER
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, show me. Show me how!

turns.speaker: TABER
turns.text: I'll bet a buck you don't do it!

turns.speaker: TABER
turns.text: Bullshit. You ain't got no way out!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: You're on.  Let's go! An' keep it quiet.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Out. It's the way out. So just keep it in your minds if ya ever wanna make use of it.

turns.speaker: TABER
turns.text: Yeah, take us back to the dumbwaiter, Mac.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: I'm not going back in there. I told ya this was a one way trip. Now stand aside.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Breakfast! Hell, I know just the place where we can chow down an' thaw out before we shoot back on home. 'Kay?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Hey, how's it look up there, big boy?

turns.speaker: SCANLON
turns.text: He can't hear you. He's just a deaf and dumb Indian!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: You just come on with that three fifty and Martini will take care of himself... Your dice, Scanlon.

turns.speaker: SCANLON
turns.text: Gimme those dice. I'll blow this board to pieces. Here we go...  Lebenty leben, count me over eleven, Martini...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Shhhh. See ya around the ball park.

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: What you boys doin' up at this ungodly time o' the night?

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Well, you boys finish it up an' climb back into your beds. 'Kay?

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: I thought I told you boys to go to bed!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Our prayers have been answered, Turkle! Our prayers have been answered!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: I tell ya, there's an angel of mercy standing out there, Turkle.

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Hallelujah, brother, now get back in bed!

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: That angel of mercy, he ain't a she, is he?

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Ah believe ya, brother. Ah believe ya!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Now, wouldn't you pray for twenty bucks, a bottle booze an' a piece of that angel cake?

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Ah'm on my knees, brother, ah'm on my knees.

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: I'll be very glad to show you around, Miss...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, that's a good idea, Turkle. Why don't ya take Rose on a little tour of our facilities...

turns.speaker: NURSE ITSU
turns.text: Fine, thank you.  Here, please take these.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: You know, I never got your name.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: You comin' in to hold my hand?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah... Well, see ya around, Itsu.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Okay, Mack!  Whoowe, Candy girl, are we in an insane asylum or ain't we?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: How's your ass been holdin' up, honey?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Hi ya, big boy? How's it goin'? Like it in here?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: He can't hear you, Rose. He's just a big deaf an' dumb indian...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Sure, I know Chuck. I know him.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Well, listen to this. He got mad at me one day. Boy, did he get mad at me. He took the light bulb, ya know. I thought he was going to cram it right up me, ya know. But he ate it. He ate the whole fucking light bulb.  Now, tell me! Is he crazy? Tell me! Is he crazy?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Sure, she understands what you mean. She's not dumb. Why do you think Rose came to visit us? Rose is very interested in hospitals and hospital facilities. Aren't you, Rose?

turns.speaker: SEFELT
turns.text: That kind of behavior will get you a P.A. rating, my friend.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: P.A. What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Hit, you say? Well well well and with a king up, the boy wants a hit. Whadaya know. So comin' at you and too bad, a little lady for the lad and he's over the wall and down the road, up the hill and dropped his load.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yeah, how much you wanna bet?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: That me an' my buddy, Cheswick, we'll be downtown tomorrow watchin' the ballgame while you suckers are sittin' around this goddamn nursery!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Maybe I'll just use that thick skull of yours as a batterin' ram, Sefelt.

turns.speaker: SEFELT
turns.text: Why, my head would just squash like an eggplant, McMurphy.

turns.speaker: SEFELT
turns.text: Yes, I see it! I see it!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Hey, Martini! Psst! Scanlon! Ya dumb goons, come back here!  Come on, let's get 'em!

turns.speaker: SEFELT
turns.text: I thought I might donate it to the mess hall.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yes, sir, it's a mighty nice fall day...

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Yes, sir, I sure am gonna enjoy my stay here.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Ya know, I ain't never been in an institution of psychology before.

turns.speaker: MISS PILBOW
turns.text: Make yourself at home, Mister McMurphy...

turns.speaker: WASHINGTON
turns.text: Nobody leaves here till seven thirty.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Don't know if I can hold it that long, Sam.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Who do you like in the opening game, Sam?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Hey, Sam, bet ya two bucks ya lose.

turns.speaker: WASHINGTON
turns.text: Shit, man, tha' ain't even worth considerin'.

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: What kind of crap is that???

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Ya fuckin' coon, you're not on the ward now!

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: We got your black ass now, Washington, wanna bet another twenty?

turns.speaker: MCMURPHY
turns.text: Hey, Billy, stop cryin'. You don't have to cry... You ain't got nothin' to be ashamed of. She ain't gonna tell you mother... stop crying...

turns.speaker: NIGHT SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Oh, there you are, Mister Turkle.

turns.speaker: NIGHT SUPERVISOR
turns.text: The lights were flashing on and off, Mister Turkle.

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Cleanliness is a twenty-four-hour job, ma'am...

turns.speaker: NIGHT SUPERVISOR
turns.text: What are these men doing up wandering around?

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Ah guess the natives are restless, ma'am...

turns.speaker: NIGHT SUPERVISOR
turns.text: You've been drinking on the job again, haven't you, Mister Turkle!

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Ah, no, ma'am... well, yes, ma'am...  A man get awful lonely at night, if ya know what Ah mean, ma'am...

turns.speaker: NIGHT SUPERVISOR
turns.text: I want those men put back to bed, Mister Turkle!

turns.speaker: NIGHT SUPERVISOR
turns.text: And you haven't heard the last of this!

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Shhh... let's move it away from the window...

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Oh, that. That ain't nothin' to be afraid of, ma'am. Just ol Chief Bromden. That's all...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Is he one of the loonies?

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: They're sleeping, Miss. They're sleeping. An' we gotta keep it down so we don't disturb their sleep.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Are they dangerous when they're awake?

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Oh, no, Miss. Not these loonies. These are nice guys. Nice guys.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Smells like piss. Is this real, Candy? Is this really real? I mean we are in an insane asylum, an' I wanna know how we got ourselves into this scene.

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Shhh, please, Miss. Keep it down...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Yeah, well, I'll tell ya somethin'. I'll tell ya somethin'. I had this boyfriend, Chuck.  Ya know him, Mac. Ya remember, Chuck.

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Well, Miss... I would say... I would say, yes. Yes, he's crazy.

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Oh, I see. He was a very sick man. Very sick.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: That's what I told his mother. And she said I was crazy. Her son ate the whole fucking light bulb and she said I was crazy.

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: I don't know anything about that, Miss. I would have to examine you first...

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Well, I'm running a risk by letting you in, Miss. You know I'm runnin' a risk of gettin' my black ass fired. If you understand what I mean...

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Now, Miss. What do you want with twenty zombies when you got a twenty gun salute looking you right in the face.

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: You better believe it, you sweet little thing. You better believe it...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Don't you sweet talk me you ol' spook, you!

turns.speaker: TURKLE
turns.text: Oh, I'm all through talkin'. Now, let's just you an' me trip on down that hall.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Yes, but...  He was having an affair.

turns.speaker: KATE
turns.text: Look, she wasn't a relative, okay? I don't know who she is.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: May I see your boarding pass, please?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: I'm sorry, but without a boarding pass we can't let you on the plane.
